website_summaries.verdict: Nimble, durable, and comfortable - the Merrell All Out Blaze Sieve water sandals get high marks for their performance on and off the water. A big plus is its durable Vibram outsole that is stiff enough for day hiking in easy trails.While dirt and debris can be a bit challenging to deal with, this hiking shoe offers plenty of features. They fit the bill for anyone looking for lightweight hiking shoes that they can take to the beach, forest trails, and everywhere else that calls for highly breathable footwear.
pros: The majority of the Merrell All Out Blaze Sieve reviews talk about how comfortable it is, with or without socks
It's a lightweight everyday outdoor shoe, which makes climbing and hiking easier, according to many
Plenty of users also give it high ratings for its sturdy build
Several people mention about the grippy and stiff sole of the All Out Blaze Sieve convertible sandal that makes it good enough for light hiking
Lots of verified buyers highly recommend this water hiking shoe for being protective and supportive
This shoe-like sandal is also very lightweight, which has pleased many users
cons: They aren't very good for wet rock hiking, according to several users
A few hikers have had problems shaking off pebbles, sand, and rocks from their Merrell All Out Blaze Sieve water shoes

customer_reviews.title: Goodbye Merrell. We are done.
customer_reviews.text: As others have noted, the plastic loops that join the rear ankle strap are ridiculously fragile. One was broken on arrival - this did nothing to convince me the other three would survive even moderate wear. As a former fan of Merrell I am deeply disappointed at this shambolic piece of skimping, shoddy design on what is far from a cheap shoe. Merrell, I am done with you.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Pelton

customer_reviews.title: Not up to the standard I expect from Merrell
customer_reviews.text: OK only. Replacement for a pair of Merrell 'Rapid Pulse' sandals which have lasted years- covering probably thousands of miles. These really don't come up to the standard I would expect from Merrell being rather flimsy, I certainly don't expect to get much life out of them.. If I wasn't going on holiday in the next few days I would probably have returned them. Soles quite thin, supposed to be made of 'Vibram' they don't look like it to me unless Vibram has changed radically in the last few years. Basically a pair of cheap trainers that has been modified.
customer_reviews.author: big norman

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't conform to UK sizing standards. If you want a nine, order an eight, and so on.
customer_reviews.author: John 'Skyline'

customer_reviews.title: Good fit, take the time to set up straps ...
customer_reviews.text: Good fit, take the time to set up straps and buckles to prevent rubbing or hot spots and they were good to go straight from the box. Would have preferred the rear heel strap to sit higher or be a bit longer but I wouldn't go up a size just for that. There is enough space around the edge and lip at front saves toes from getting hit. Grips well on wet rocks and has taken the beating from that environment unscathed so far. Impressed.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: Initially I ordered size 8 or 42 but was advised by the company to order size 7, which I did. I like the sandals but they are not the quality I am used to for the price. I have worn them but had to have the straps fully extended, on the edge, and my feet swelled up with the pressure. They are too small and too slim. Normally Clarks 7G fit me perfectly but sadly these did not.
customer_reviews.author: peter robinson

customer_reviews.title: Not yet "road tested" but reasonably satisfied. Some concern about rough edges that will need ...
customer_reviews.text: Not yet "road tested" but reasonably satisfied. Some concern about rough edges that will need to be taped over before risking feet on a long walk.
customer_reviews.author: TH

customer_reviews.title: Comfy
customer_reviews.text: Just what I was looking for. Smart, very comfortable and good value.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: excellent for hot climates, walked miles in these over a year now and lasting well
customer_reviews.author: Peter Sussex

customer_reviews.title: Sizing too large
customer_reviews.text: The sandals were too large by at least one size so I have returned them & shall order a smaller size. The quality of the sandal appeared to be good with a reasonably thick sole.
customer_reviews.author: Ron D

customer_reviews.title: There is no way they are a size 8 what ...
customer_reviews.text: There is no way they are a size 8 what I ordered. They are bigger than all my other shoes so I know they are no way a size 8
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Take care if you have wide feet!
customer_reviews.text: Great quality sandal, but the straps are a bit short so if you have wide feet they may be a bit tight to start with.
customer_reviews.author: Jmedr8n

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable... until they fall apart after only 3 months
customer_reviews.text: I was very happy with those in the first 3 months. Very comfortable, in the city and out in the woods. Unfortunately those started to fall apart at the end of the summer. I did not expect this from Merell.
customer_reviews.author: Yavor

customer_reviews.title: Supposed quality shoes but stitching came undone after no time at all.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these shoes in May. I have used them about 10 times and the stitching on one heel strap has broken. I have not tried them on any rugged terrain. It seems it is too late to get them replaced even though the pair I received must have been defective. I am very disappointed. I thought Merrell was a quality brand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought just under 2yrs ago under average wear and falling apart.My own fault because when I received them I thought they don’t look up to Merrell standard.Will not buy on line again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Merrell Men's All Out Blaze Sieve Convert Hiking Sandals
product_meta.description: Merrell All Out Blaze Sieve Convertible Walking Sandal This hydro-hiker from Merrell has been specifically built for the wettest conditions. The sandal offers maximum breathability to keep you stable and comfortable as you move. Waterproof PU Coated Leather Upper The Merrell All Out Blaze Sieve Convertible sandal is constructed with a waterproof PU coated leather fabric upper which enables you to walk through streams with ease. Offering a high level of breathability during warm climates, it will help you overcome the discomfort of sweaty feet. A hook and loop strap enables simple, efficient fastening to keep your feet secure while a removable back strap offers easy conversion from a sports sandal to a slide. Vibram TC5+ Outsole Made with a TC5+ Vibram Outsole, it ensures solid traction that will keep you going all day long. Mile after mile, Vibram's high-performance rubber soles take on tough terrain with unmatched durability, stability and slip resistance. Hollowed lugs offer a lightweight, streamlined effect to help improve mobility. The lugs also ensure a full, unrestricted range of motion in all directions and optimum flexibility.
feature_bullets: Waterproof PU Coated Leather Upper - Keeps your feet dry and protected.
Breathable - Encourages cool air to circulate.
Moisture Management - Wicks away excess sweat and moisture.
Hook And Loop Strap - Enables simple, effective fastening.
Removable Back Strap - Convert the sandal from a sports sandal to a slide.
